class_notes:
(Same as LACS 270 4)


This course provides an overview of histories of health and healing in Latin America from independence to the present. Main questions considered include: How have approaches to healing and medical institutions changed over time and space? In what ways did indigenous and African healers and figure into and everyday life? How have gender and race shaped public health policies? Students will investigate diverse actors through readings and will construct their own short histories through writing assignments. Students will also use primary documents, films, and secondary material to analyze and construct arguments. No prior knowledge of Latin American history, medicine, or Spanish/ Portuguese language is required to take this course.
